intro: Corniola mantica, commonly known as the common corniola, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and partial to full sunlight. Corniola mantica is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along roadsides.
